text: The White Cliffs of Dover are cliffs in Dover, England. The cliffs are a part of the North Downs cliff formation. The cliffs are white because they are mostly chalk with bits of flint mixed in. These cliffs are a major tourist destination for thousands of people every year. The cliffs are also the biggest cliffs in Great Britain. == Other websites == * Dover Museum information on the cliffs Category:Geography of Kent Category:Areas of Outstanding Natural Beauty
title: White Cliffs of Dover
